content.description: The perfect magician of the knights templar just 'appears' as you get close and misdirects with it's crack as the trick drawing your focus away from its face. Grab the horn of Boaz as the final move and be pleased with your secret ritual of the Ordo Templi Orienti.
content.protection: I wouldn't advise it, but there's a pretty bombproof anchor about 40 feet past the edge (you'll get this if you go)Midisize to large nuts, a few TCUs or purple camalots can set up an anchor above the crack.

content.description: Get on the wall any way you canChose the dark path (literally)Good feet hide in camouflageTop is not a gimmieThis could be a boulder problem but the landing is horrendous.
content.protection: TR, use the massive 'industrial' anchor (and long webbing) if needed or set an anchor in the summit crack with medium to large nuts and cams, TCU's or purple camalots)
content.location: Get on the wall above the cave any way you can (use the pit start of Perfect Magician and leave to the of its obvious crack). There's a black streak marking the route.

content.description: Follow the obvious flake and repeat the mantra, 'looks loose, sounds loose, feels loose' over and over again until you can get out of there.
content.protection: Beware and advise downstream guests of the flake's potential danger

content.description: Obvious lines. The area gets it's name from an peculiar and pointless bit of carved graffiti nearby of the Mason's compass and square.2 areas -The "Lodge of Perfection" is the large block to the left, facing the trees."Veiled Prophets of the Enchanted Realm (simply and affectionately known as the Grotto)" is the steppe to the right, facing down hill
